verdict.summary: The index-pack process failed while processing received pack data during fetch/clone. Typically caused by insufficient memory for large repos, corrupted pack data from network issues, or disk space exhaustion.

dead_ends.action: Repeatedly retrying the clone without addressing the memory issue
dead_ends.why_fails: If the failure is due to insufficient memory for indexing a large pack, retrying produces the same OOM failure each time

dead_ends.action: Increasing only the HTTP buffer without addressing pack memory limits
dead_ends.why_fails: http.postBuffer affects push, not fetch/clone. The index-pack process has its own memory requirements independent of HTTP buffering

workarounds.action: Increase pack memory limits and use shallow clone
workarounds.how: Set git config --global pack.windowMemory 256m and git config --global pack.threads 1 to reduce memory usage. Or use git clone --depth 1 for a shallow clone to reduce pack size.

workarounds.action: Clone via SSH instead of HTTPS to avoid transfer encoding issues
workarounds.how: If using HTTPS, switch to SSH: git clone git@github.com:user/repo.git. SSH uses a different transfer protocol that can be more reliable for large repositories.

leads_to.condition: when pack processing issues affect both receiving and sending
when partial pack indexing results in corrupted objects

preceded_by.condition: when intermittent network issues cause partial pack data transfer

frequently_confused_with.distinction: index-pack-failed occurs on the receiving side (fetch/clone); pack-objects-died occurs on the sending side (push) or during local repacking
